task2_government_pdfs_drc.title: Mining Code of the Democratic Republic of Congo (Law No. 18/001 of March 9, 2018)

chunks.text: The holder of a mining title must conduct an environmental and social impact study, including consultations with affected local communities before exploitation.
Mining concessions require approval from the Mining Cadastre and prior agreement with customary landowners in rural areas.
Local communities must benefit from mining activities through development funds and participation in decision-making processes.

task2_government_pdfs_drc.title: Guidelines for the Revision of Mining Contracts in the DRC

chunks.text: Contract revisions must include provisions for community consultations to ensure fair benefit-sharing and mitigate conflicts in mining zones.
In areas affected by armed groups like M23, concessions require security assessments and local stakeholder input to prevent exploitation.
Align with international standards, though DRC has not ratified ILO 169; focus on customary rights for Pygmy and other vulnerable groups.
